citation.article-title: Sediminibacillus halophilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic, Gram-positive bacterium from a hypersaline lake.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sediminibacillus halophilus sp. nov.
Sediminibacillus halophilus (ha.lo.phi′lus. Gr. n. halos salt; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. masc. adj. halophilus salt-loving).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are 0.9×1.5–7.0 μm in size.
Colonies are 1 mm in diameter, cream-pigmented, circular and entire on HM-7.5 medium after 24 h cultivation at 37 °C.
Grows over a wide concentration range of salts (0–20 %, w/v), with optimal growth occurring at 5–7.5 % (w/v) salts.
Grows at 15–55 °C (optimally at 37 °C) and at pH 5.0–9.5 (optimally at pH 7.5).
Aesculin, gelatin and Tween 80 are hydrolysed.
Casein, DNA and starch are not hydrolysed.
Phosphatase test is positive.
H2S is not produced.
Indole, Voges–Proskauer and phenylalanine deaminase tests are negative.
Acid is produced from arabinose, lactose, d-glucose, d-galactose, d-mannose, trehalose, d-fructose, sucrose, maltose and glycerol.
d-Arabinose, cellobiose, d-galactose and d-lactose are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon and energy sources: acetate, benzoate, butanol, citrate, ethanol, l-fucose, formate, fumarate, maltose, d-mannose, melibiose, melezitose, methanol, propionate, propanol, raffinose, d-sorbitol, succinate, valerate and d-xylose.
l-Alanine, l-serine and l-threonine are used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources.

The following compounds are not used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: l-arginine, aspartic acid, l-cysteine, glutamic acid, dl-lysine, l-methionine, l-ornithine, phenylalanine and tryptophan.
The cell wall contains peptidoglycan of the meso-diaminopimelic acid type.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
The polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and an unidentified glycolipid.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 47.5 mol% (Tm).
The type strain, EN8dT (=CCM 7364T =CECT 7148T =CGMCC 1.6199T =DSM 18088T), was isolated from sediment from Lake Erliannor in Inner Mongolia, China.
